articles.description: Tim Stutzle was preoccupied with the referees too often, Fabian Zetterlund took a brutal penalty to give Nashville all of the momentum, and James Reimer couldn't make that last clutch save for Ottawa in a devastating 5-3 loss.

articles.title: Winnipeg Jets fall to Panthers 2-1 in a shootout
articles.description: Cole Perfetti scored the lone goal for Winnipeg early in the third before Anton Lundell and Sam Reinhart scored in the shootout for the Panthers.

articles.title: Oil Climbs as Weak Dollar and Risk-On Mood Counter Glut Worries
articles.description: Oil gained as a weaker dollar and risk-on mood in wider markets offset concerns about higher supplies in the US and elsewhere.

articles.title: Trump Muses About Asking NATO to Help Protect US Southern Border
articles.description: President Donald Trump openly mused about invoking NATO’s collective defense obligation to place allied troops along the US-Mexico border, a suggestion that, even if not meant seriously, represents another volley of rhetoric aimed squarely at European allies.

articles.title: Ottawa Senators suffer an epic collapse in ugly 5-3 loss to Nashville Predators
articles.description: The Ottawa Senators left the Music City singing a hurtin’ tune, and they had nobody to blame but themselves. The Senators blew a three-goal lead only to see Steven Stamkos complete the hat-trick with 1:13 left to secure a 5-3 victory for the Nashville Predators on Thursday at Bridgestone Arena

articles.title: Montreal’s ‘7 Paintings’ dinner lets guests taste, interact with art
articles.description: Montrealers looking for a unique evening can now immerse themselves in a fusion of art, storytelling and fine cuisine at a new interactive dinner show, 7 Paintings – The Art of Dining.
